Starting with an empty grid of dots, 2 players take turns, adding a single horizontal or vertical line between two unjoined adjacent dots. You can do this by pressing your finger in between any 2 dots.

 A player who completes the fourth side of a 1Ã—1 box earns one point and takes another turn. 

 The game ends when no more lines can be placed. The winner of the game is the player with the most points.

Code written in Java using Eclipse. 

Sound recorded in Audacity. 

Graphics created in Photoshop CS6.

Pressing the menu button across any of the acitivties will bring up the same instance of the menu. 

 Game settings can be found in this menu and include toggling Sound Effects and chosing the computer difficulty. These options save on exit and are loaded again when the application is opened again. 

 When chosing player colours, if a user selects the same colour on both players then when the 'Start Game' button is pressed they will be presented with an error message. 

 If a player presses on a line that has already been selected then they will be presented with an error toast message. 

 When a game is completed the user gets a message to show who was the winner. 

 The undo button will undo the previous turn even if that turn was the CPU's turn, it is up to the user to press undo until it gets to Player 1's turn. If they do click while it is the bots turn then they will recieve a message.
